alert.note: Alert for Burleson; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 25 at 8:46PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Burleson and western Washington Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 846 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Burton, or 11 miles east of Giddings, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burton, Lake Somerville Dam, Carmine and Quarry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
